MagTrace
  • Installation Guide
  • View page source

Installation GuideÔÉÅ

MagTrace is designed to be easy to install and run on any system with Python 3.8+.

System RequirementsÔÉÅ

Minimum Requirements: - Python 3.8 or higher - 4GB RAM (8GB recommended for large datasets) - 1GB disk space - Modern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)

Operating Systems: - Windows 10/11 - macOS 10.14+ - Linux (Ubuntu 18.04+, CentOS 7+, or equivalent)

Quick Installation (Recommended)ÔÉÅ

1. Clone the Repository

git clone https://github.com/manasp21/MagTrace.git
cd MagTrace

2. Run the Application

python3 run.py

That‚Äôs it! The run script will automatically:

‚úÖ Create a Python virtual environment ‚úÖ Install all required dependencies ‚úÖ Set up the database ‚úÖ Start the application server

3. Open in Browser

Navigate to http://localhost:8000/app/ and you‚Äôre ready to go!

Manual InstallationÔÉÅ

If you prefer manual control over the installation process:

1. Create Virtual Environment

cd backend
python3 -m venv venv

# On Linux/macOS:
source venv/bin/activate

# On Windows:
venv\Scripts\activate

2. Install Dependencies

pip install -r requirements.txt

Note: If TensorFlow installation fails (common on some systems), use the lightweight version:

pip install -r requirements-lite.txt

3. Database Setup

python manage.py migrate
python manage.py createsuperuser  # Optional

4. Start Server

python manage.py runserver

The application will be available at http://localhost:8000/app/

Docker Installation (Advanced)ÔÉÅ

For containerized deployment:

# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/manasp21/MagTrace.git
cd MagTrace

# Build Docker image
docker build -t magtrace .

# Run container
docker run -p 8000:8000 magtrace

Development InstallationÔÉÅ

For developers who want to contribute:

1. Fork and Clone

git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/MagTrace.git
cd MagTrace

2. Install Development Dependencies

cd backend
python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # or venv\Scripts\activate on Windows
pip install -r requirements.txt
pip install -r requirements-dev.txt  # Additional dev tools

3. Set Up Pre-commit Hooks

pre-commit install

4. Run Tests

python3 test_workflow.py
python manage.py test

Verifying InstallationÔÉÅ

Quick Health Check

Visit http://localhost:8000/health/ - you should see:

{
  "status": "healthy",
  "timestamp": "2025-06-17T..."
}

Complete Workflow Test

Run the automated test suite:

python3 test_workflow.py

You should see output like:

üöÄ Starting MagTrace Workflow Test
‚úÖ Server health check passed
‚úÖ Project created successfully
‚úÖ Dataset uploaded successfully
‚úÖ Data retrieval successful: 46 data points
‚úÖ Annotation created successfully
‚úÖ Training started successfully
üéâ All workflow tests completed successfully!

TroubleshootingÔÉÅ

Common Issues:

Port 8000 Already in Use

# Find and kill process using port 8000
lsof -ti:8000 | xargs kill -9

# Or use a different port
python manage.py runserver 8001

Python Version Issues

# Check Python version
python3 --version

# If < 3.8, install newer Python
# Ubuntu/Debian:
sudo apt update && sudo apt install python3.9

# macOS:
brew install python@3.9

TensorFlow Installation Fails

This is normal! MagTrace works perfectly with scikit-learn only:

pip install -r requirements-lite.txt

Virtual Environment Issues

# Remove and recreate virtual environment
rm -rf backend/venv
cd backend
python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt

Database Issues

# Reset database
rm backend/db.sqlite3
python backend/manage.py migrate

Permission Errors (Linux/macOS)

# Make run script executable
chmod +x run.py

Configuration OptionsÔÉÅ

Environment Variables

Create a .env file in the backend directory:

# Development settings
DEBUG=True
SECRET_KEY=your-secret-key-here

# Database (optional - defaults to SQLite)
DATABASE_URL=sqlite:///db.sqlite3

# Performance
DATA_DECIMATION_THRESHOLD=5000

Advanced Settings

Edit backend/magtrace_api/settings.py for advanced configuration:

  • Database backend (PostgreSQL, MySQL)

  • Caching settings (Redis, Memcached)

  • Security settings for production

  • CORS and API settings

Production DeploymentÔÉÅ

For production environments, see the deployment guide which covers:

  • Web server configuration (Nginx, Apache)

  • WSGI deployment (Gunicorn, uWSGI)

  • Database configuration (PostgreSQL)

  • SSL/TLS setup

  • Performance optimization

  • Monitoring and logging

Next StepsÔÉÅ

Once installed, continue with:

  1. Quick Start Tutorial - Complete your first analysis in 10 minutes

  2. <no title> - Comprehensive usage guide with examples

  3. Sample datasets - Download sample magnetic field data to try
